title: Windows 10
body: Ok, so essentially I've upgraded to Windows 10, and this is where my problem arose, I actually can not play league anymore without my computer completely crashing at either random points or right when the game begins. I found a temporary solution, but it doesn't work all the time, and I'm getting really irritated. I've seen a few others with this same problem with them getting the previous Windows 10 update and being unable to play without crashing. I've gotten a 5 game leaver buster because of so many "leave" games in a row, when in reality I've just crashed at the very beginning and can't join in without my team already remaking. I know this isn't a problem that Riot caused, but I'd really appreciate some way to fix this. Thank you for your feedback.

replies.body:
One of the biggest pain points as of recent with Windows 10 has been the Game Bar. The Windows 10 Anniversary update enabled a new feature in the game bar called *Game DVR*, which has been causing PC freezes and forcing some players to restart their PC to bypass. 

A lot of the time, this can be resolved by [disabling the game bar entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html). Let me know if this worked for you.
Thank you very much for the solution, it works just fine now. I'm glad there are people out there who can help fix these problems : )
